questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
Box 1: No -
Microsoft handles all patching and updating of the SQL and operating system code. You don't have to manage the underlying infrastructure.

Box 2: Yes -
SQL Database is a fully managed service that has built-in high availability, backups, and other common maintenance operations.

Box 3: No -
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-sql/database/sql-database-paas-overview

discussion.content:
I took the exam 12.04.2023; this question appeared, correct answer:
select / group by

Avanced level to this exam DP-900....
But...but lets go !

SELECT - to have any results, you need a SELECT statement. 
GROUP BY - The sales date is our criteria of aggregating the rows. 
Because there is an AVG() function call in the SELECT, the resulting groups will have 1 row each, resulting in the table below

Appeared on the exam on 03/22/2022
Answers are correct! Select/Group by
SELECT & GROUP BY is the correct answer.

questions.answer_description:
Box 1: SELECT -

Box 2: GROUP BY -
Example:
When used with a GROUP BY clause, each aggregate function produces a single value covering each group, instead of a single value covering the whole table.
The following example produces summary values for each sales territory in the AdventureWorks2012 database. The summary lists the average bonus received by the sales people in each territory, and the sum of year-to-date sales for each territory.
SELECT TerritoryID, AVG(Bonus)as 'Average bonus', SUM(SalesYTD) as 'YTD sales'

FROM Sales.SalesPerson -
GROUP BY TerritoryID;
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/functions/avg-transact-sql

discussion.content: Answer is B. When you first deploy Azure SQL, you specify an admin login and an associated password for that login. This administrative account is called Server admin. Link :https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-sql/database/logins-create-manage
Answer is correct, provided the admin user is trying to connect from an IP that is allowed through the DB firewall.

Selected Answer: B
When you create an Azure SQL database, the server admin login account of the logical server, also known as the "server admin" or "administrator" account, can always connect to the database. This account is created when the logical server is created and is used to manage the server and its databases.

B. the server admin login account of the logical server can always connect to the database. This account is also known as the "server-level principal login" and it is created automatically when you create a new Azure SQL server. This account has the highest level of permissions and can be used to perform all management tasks on the server and the databases it contains.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct answer.

Selected Answer: B
Appeared on the exam on 03/22/2022
Answer is correct!

B. the server admin login account of the logical server 
is correct answer

comments.content: correction, SysAdmin is a role and can be assigned to any account. So Server Account is the correct answer.

discussion.content: I think Sys Admin (SA account) is the correct answer.
Answer B is correct. The logical server credentials when you created it is equivalent to SA account on premises.

I think A is the correct answer.
For B, what does 'local server' mean? Azure SQL Server is a PaaS, user does not need to consider "server" at all.

comments.content: The server here implies the DB server, not the server that hosts the DB. User still needs to consider the DB server since you have to provide a user-id and password when you create the Azure SQL database. So I do think that the correct answer is B.

questions.question_text: When you create an Azure SQL database, which account can always connect to the database?

choices.C: the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) administrator account
choices.B: the server admin login account of the logical server
choices.A: the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) account that created the database

questions.question_text:
A team of developers has computers that run Windows 10 and Ubuntu Desktop.
The developers need to connect to and query an Azure SQL database from each of their computers. The developers require code assistance features such as
IntelliSense.
What should the developers use?
